column4: what is the simplest way to switch to 32bit when I'm already running 64bit, is there a command for downloading and installing 32bit packages for everything?
You can install a 32bit system in a "chroot jail" which lets you switch to 32bit to run specific apps (like firefox with Flash plugin)
To get in it just do "sudo chroot /whereveryourchrootjailis"
You can install Qemu and emulate/virtualise, or do the smae thing with vmwareplayer
